newsitem.title: FINLAND: ALANDSBANKEN SAYS ALANDIABOLAGEN CUTS STAKE.
newsitem.headline: ALANDSBANKEN SAYS ALANDIABOLAGEN CUTS STAKE.

text.p: Aland islands-based bank Alandsbanken AB said in a statement on Thursday that insurer Alandiabolagen's ownership stake in the bank had fallen below 10 percent of shares.
Alandiabolagen's holding was now 9.6 percent, it said, adding the insurer held 11.6 percent of votes.
Alandsbanken did not say by how much Alandiabolagen's stake had fallen.
In a share issue prospectus last spring, Alandsbanken said that on March 4, 1996, Alandiabolagen was its second biggest owner with 10.5 percent of shares and 11.6 percent of votes.
Alandsbanken's ordinary shares entitle holders to 20 votes per share and preferred shares give holders one vote per share.
At 1535/1335 GMT, Alandsbanken was untraded after closing at 102.00 markka on Tuesday.
